intro: Coleosanthus dentatus, commonly known as the toothed sedge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. It often grows in wetland or swampy environments, contributing to the ecological diversity of these habitats.
